page.title: 19Local History. Looking Back
page.content: Old Chepstonian,Harry Warren was born in 1906.He went to a Board School which is now a shop which sells glass. On the first day he went to school he remembers being given a piece of cloth to unravel and he had to put the different coloured threads in separate saucers.He liked school until he failed his examination to the grammar school which was in a building called High Trees which is now the District Council Offices.At 14 he left school and went to work doing odd jobs in a hotel.Then he went to work as an apprentice caulker in the shipyard.He got{15 shillings}a week and to give an idea of how much that was,1 pint of milk cost 1 penny. Mr. Warren has now retired.He has been mayor of the town and is a well respected local historian.
